unicef-cp2.def: Percentage of children 5–17 years old involved in child labour at the moment of the survey. A child is considered to be involved in child labour under the following conditions: (a) children 5–11 years old who, during the reference week, did at least one hour of economic activity and/ or more than 21 hours of unpaid household services, (b) children 12–14 years old who, during the reference week, did at least 14 hours of economic activity and/or more than 21 hours of unpaid household services, (c) children 15–17 years old who, during the reference week, did at least 43 hours of economic activity.
unicef-cp2.name: Child labour
unicef-cp2.source: DHS, MICS and other national surveys. Last update: February 2021.
unicef-cp2.dataset: DHS, MICS and other national surveys. Last update: February 2021.
